summary.long: Isaiah is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth!
For the Lord has spoken:
“I have nourished and brought up children,
And they have rebelled against Me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The ox knows its owner
And the donkey its master’s crib;
But Israel does not know,
My people do not consider.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Alas, sinful nation,
A people laden with iniquity,
A brood of evildoers,
Children who are corrupters!
They have forsaken the Lord,
They have provoked to anger
The Holy One of Israel,
They have turned away backward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should you be stricken again?
You will revolt more and more.
The whole head is sick,
And the whole heart faints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the sole of the foot even to the head,
There is no soundness in it,
But wounds and bruises and putrefying sores;
They have not been closed or bound up,
Or soothed with ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
So the daughter of Zion is left as a booth in a vineyard,
As a hut in a garden of cucumbers,
As a besieged city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Unless the Lord of hosts
Had left to us a very small remnant,
We would have become like Sodom,
We would have been made like Gomorrah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear the word of the Lord,
You rulers of Sodom;
Give ear to the law of our God,
You people of Gomorrah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“To what purpose is the multitude of your sacrifices to Me?”
Says the Lord.
“I have had enough of burnt offerings of rams
And the fat of fed cattle.
I do not delight in the blood of bulls,
Or of lambs or goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“When you come to appear before Me,
Who has required this from your hand,
To trample My courts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bring no more futile sacrifices;
Incense is an abomination to Me.
The New Moons, the Sabbaths, and the calling of assemblies—
I cannot endure iniquity and the sacred meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your New Moons and your appointed feasts
My soul hates;
They are a trouble to Me,
I am weary of bearing them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you spread out your hands,
I will hide My eyes from you;
Even though you make many prayers,
I will not hear.
Your hands are full of blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Come now, and let us reason together,”
Says the Lord,
“Though your sins are like scarlet,
They shall be as white as snow;
Though they are red like crimson,
They shall be as wool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you are willing and obedient,
You shall eat the good of the land;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
How the faithful city has become a harlot!
It was full of justice;
Righteousness lodged in it,
But now murderers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your silver has become dross,
Your wine mixed with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your princes are rebellious,
And companions of thieves;
Everyone loves bribes,
And follows after rewards.
They do not defend the fatherless,
Nor does the cause of the widow come before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the Lord says,
The Lord of hosts, the Mighty One of Israel,
“Ah, I will rid Myself of My adversaries,
And take vengeance on My enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will turn My hand against you,
And thoroughly purge away your dross,
And take away all your alloy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will restore your judges as at the first,
And your counselors as at the beginning.
Afterward you shall be called the city of righteousness, the faithful city.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zion shall be redeemed with justice,
And her penitents with righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The destruction of transgressors and of sinners shall be together,
And those who forsake the Lord shall be consumed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they shall be ashamed of the terebinth trees
Which you have desired;
And you shall be embarrassed because of the gardens
Which you have chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you shall be as a terebinth whose leaf fades,
And as a garden that has no water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The strong shall be as tinder,
And the work of it as a spark;
Both will burn together,
And no one shall quench them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that Isaiah the son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now it shall come to pass in the latter days
That the mountain of the Lord’s house
Shall be established on the top of the mountains,
And shall be exalted above the hills;
And all nations shall flow to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many people shall come and say,
“Come, and let us go up to the mountain of the Lord,
To the house of the God of Jacob;
He will teach us His ways,
And we shall walk in His paths.”
For out of Zion shall go forth the law,
And the word of the Lord from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O house of Jacob, come and let us walk
In the light of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You have forsaken Your people, the house of Jacob,
Because they are filled with eastern ways;
They are soothsayers like the Philistines,
And they are pleased with the children of foreigners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their land is also full of silver and gold,
And there is no end to their treasures;
Their land is also full of horses,
And there is no end to their chariots.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Enter into the rock, and hide in the dust,
From the terror of the Lord
And the glory of His majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lofty looks of man shall be humbled,
The haughtiness of men shall be bowed down,
And the Lord alone shall be exalted in that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the day of the Lord of hosts
Shall come upon everything proud and lofty,
Upon everything lifted up—
And it shall be brought low—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Upon all the cedars of Lebanon that are high and lifted up,
And upon all the oaks of Bashan;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Upon all the high mountains,
And upon all the hills that are lifted up;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Upon every high tower,
And upon every fortified wall;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Upon all the ships of Tarshish,
And upon all the beautiful sloops.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: But the idols He shall utterly abolish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall go into the holes of the rocks,
And into the caves of the earth,
From the terror of the Lord
And the glory of His majesty,
When He arises to shake the earth mightily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In that day a man will cast away his idols of silver
And his idols of gold,
Which they made, each for himself to worship,
To the moles and bats,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To go into the clefts of the rocks,
And into the crags of the rugged rocks,
From the terror of the Lord
And the glory of His majesty,
When He arises to shake the earth mightily.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For behold, the Lord, the Lord of hosts,
Takes away from Jerusalem and from Judah
The stock and the store,
The whole supply of bread and the whole supply of water;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The captain of fifty and the honorable man,
The counselor and the skillful artisan,
And the expert enchanter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will give children to be their princes,
And babes shall rule over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The people will be oppressed,
Every one by another and every one by his neighbor;
The child will be insolent toward the elder,
And the base toward the honorable.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When a man takes hold of his brother
In the house of his father, saying,
“You have clothing;
You be our ruler,
And let these ruins be under your power,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In that day he will protest, saying,
“I cannot cure your ills,
For in my house is neither food nor clothing;
Do not make me a ruler of the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Jerusalem stumbled,
And Judah is fallen,
Because their tongue and their doings
Are against the Lord,
To provoke the eyes of His glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The look on their countenance witnesses against them,
And they declare their sin as Sodom;
They do not hide it.
Woe to their soul!
For they have brought evil upon themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Say to the righteous that it shall be well with them,
For they shall eat the fruit of their doings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to the wicked! It shall be ill with him,
For the reward of his hands shall be given him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for My people, children are their oppressors,
And women rule over them.
O My people! Those who lead you cause you to err,
And destroy the way of your paths.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord stands up to plead,
And stands to judge the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will enter into judgment
With the elders of His people
And His princes:
“For you have eaten up the vineyard;
The plunder of the poor is in your houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What do you mean by crushing My people
And grinding the faces of the poor?”
Says the Lord God of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moreover the Lord says:
“Because the daughters of Zion are haughty,
And walk with outstretched necks
And wanton eyes,
Walking and mincing as they go,
Making a jingling with their feet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the Lord will strike with a scab
The crown of the head of the daughters of Zion,
And the Lord will uncover their secret parts.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In that day the Lord will take away the finery:
The jingling anklets, the scarves, and the crescents;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The pendants, the bracelets, and the veils;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The headdresses, the leg ornaments, and the headbands;
The perfume boxes, the charms,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and the rings;
The nose jewels,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the festal apparel, and the mantles;
The outer garments, the purses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and the mirrors;
The fine linen, the turbans, and the robes.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your men shall fall by the sword,
And your mighty in the war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her gates shall lament and mourn,
And she being desolate shall sit on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And in that day seven women shall take hold of one man, saying,
“We will eat our own food and wear our own apparel;
Only let us be called by your name,
To take away our reproach.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass that he who is left in Zion and remains in Jerusalem will be called holy—everyone who is recorded among the living in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord has washed away the filth of the daughters of Zion, and purged the blood of Jerusalem from her midst, by the spirit of judgment and by the spirit of burning,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the Lord will create above every dwelling place of Mount Zion, and above her assemblies, a cloud and smoke by day and the shining of a flaming fire by night. For over all the glory there will be a covering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there will be a tabernacle for shade in the daytime from the heat, for a place of refuge, and for a shelter from storm and rain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now let me sing to my Well-beloved
A song of my Beloved regarding His vineyard: 
My Well-beloved has a vineyard
On a very fruitful hill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He dug it up and cleared out its stones,
And planted it with the choicest vine.
He built a tower in its midst,
And also made a winepress in it;
So He expected it to bring forth good grapes,
But it brought forth wild grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And now, O inhabitants of Jerusalem and men of Judah,
Judge, please, between Me and My vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What more could have been done to My vineyard
That I have not done in it?
Why then, when I expected it to bring forth good grapes,
Did it bring forth wild grapes?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will lay it waste;
It shall not be pruned or dug,
But there shall come up briers and thorns.
I will also command the clouds
That they rain no rain on it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the vineyard of the Lord of hosts is the house of Israel,
And the men of Judah are His pleasant plant.
He looked for justice, but behold, oppression;
For righteousness, but behold, a cry for help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to those who join house to house;
They add field to field,
Till there is no place
Where they may dwell alone in the midst of the land!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In my hearing the Lord of hosts said,
“Truly, many houses shall be desolate,
Great and beautiful ones, without inhabitant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For ten acres of vineyard shall yield one bath,
And a homer of seed shall yield one ephah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The harp and the strings,
The tambourine and flute,
And wine are in their feasts;
But they do not regard the work of the Lord,
Nor consider the operation of His hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore my people have gone into captivity,
Because they have no knowledge;
Their honorable men are famished,
And their multitude dried up with thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore Sheol has enlarged itself
And opened its mouth beyond measure;
Their glory and their multitude and their pomp,
And he who is jubilant, shall descend into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People shall be brought down,
Each man shall be humbled,
And the eyes of the lofty shall be humbled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord of hosts shall be exalted in judgment,
And God who is holy shall be hallowed in righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the lambs shall feed in their pasture,
And in the waste places of the fat ones strangers shall eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to those who draw iniquity with cords of vanity,
And sin as if with a cart rope;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That say, “Let Him make speed and hasten His work,
That we may see it;
And let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel draw near and come,
That we may know it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to those who are wise in their own eyes,
And prudent in their own sight!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to men mighty at drinking wine,
Woe to men valiant for mixing intoxicating drink,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who justify the wicked for a bribe,
And take away justice from the righteous man!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, as the fire devours the stubble,
And the flame consumes the chaff,
So their root will be as rottenness,
And their blossom will ascend like dust;
Because they have rejected the law of the Lord of hosts,
And despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the anger of the Lord is aroused against His people;
He has stretched out His hand against them
And stricken them,
And the hills trembled.
Their carcasses were as refuse in the midst of the streets. 
For all this His anger is not turned away,
But His hand is stretched out still.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Whose arrows are sharp,
And all their bows bent;
Their horses’ hooves will seem like flint,
And their wheels like a whirlwind.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
In that day they will roar against them
Like the roaring of the sea.
And if one looks to the land,
Behold, darkness and sorrow;
And the light is darkened by the clouds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the year that King Uzziah died, I saw the Lord sitting on a throne, high and lifted up, and the train of His robe filled the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Above it stood seraphim; each one had six wings: with two he covered his face, with two he covered his feet, and with two he flew.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: And the posts of the door were shaken by the voice of him who cried out, and the house was filled with smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I said:
“Woe is me, for I am undone!
Because I am a man of unclean lips,
And I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips;
For my eyes have seen the King,
The Lord of hosts.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the seraphim flew to me, having in his hand a live coal which he had taken with the tongs from the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he touched my mouth with it, and said:
“Behold, this has touched your lips;
Your iniquity is taken away,
And your sin purged.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also I heard the voice of the Lord, saying:
“Whom shall I send,
And who will go for Us?”
Then I said, “Here am I! Send me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Make the heart of this people dull,
And their ears heavy,
And shut their eyes;
Lest they see with their eyes,
And hear with their ears,
And understand with their heart,
And return and be healed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I said, “Lord, how long?”
And He answered:
“Until the cities are laid waste and without inhabitant,
The houses are without a man,
The land is utterly desolate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has removed men far away,
And the forsaken places are many in the midst of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But yet a tenth will be in it,
And will return and be for consuming,
As a terebinth tree or as an oak,
Whose stump remains when it is cut down.
So the holy seed shall be its stump.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass in the days of Ahaz the son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah, king of Judah, that Rezin king of Syria and Pekah the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, went up to Jerusalem to make war against it, but could not prevail against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was told to the house of David, saying, “Syria’s forces are deployed in Ephraim.” So his heart and the heart of his people were moved as the trees of the woods are moved with the wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Isaiah, “Go out now to meet Ahaz, you and Shear-Jashub your son, at the end of the aqueduct from the upper pool, on the highway to the Fuller’s Field,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say to him: ‘Take heed, and be quiet; do not fear or be fainthearted for these two stubs of smoking firebrands, for the fierce anger of Rezin and Syria, and the son of Remaliah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because Syria, Ephraim, and the son of Remaliah have plotted evil against you, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let us go up against Judah and trouble it, and let us make a gap in its wall for ourselves, and set a king over them, the son of Tabel”—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
thus says the Lord God:
“It shall not stand,
Nor shall it come to pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the head of Syria is Damascus,
And the head of Damascus is Rezin.
Within sixty-five years Ephraim will be broken,
So that it will not be a people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The head of Ephraim is Samaria,
And the head of Samaria is Remaliah’s son.
If you will not believe,
Surely you shall not be established.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover the Lord spoke again to Ahaz, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Ask a sign for yourself from the Lord your God; ask it either in the depth or in the height above.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Ahaz said, “I will not ask, nor will I test the Lord!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Hear now, O house of David! Is it a small thing for you to weary men, but will you weary my God also?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Lord Himself will give you a sign: Behold, the virgin shall conceive and bear a Son, and shall call His name Immanuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Curds and honey He shall eat, that He may know to refuse the evil and choose the good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For before the Child shall know to refuse the evil and choose the good, the land that you dread will be forsaken by both her kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will bring the king of Assyria upon you and your people and your father’s house—days that have not come since the day that Ephraim departed from Judah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And it shall come to pass in that day
That the Lord will whistle for the fly
That is in the farthest part of the rivers of Egypt,
And for the bee that is in the land of Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will come, and all of them will rest
In the desolate valleys and in the clefts of the rocks,
And on all thorns and in all pastures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the same day the Lord will shave with a hired razor,
With those from beyond the River, with the king of Assyria,
The head and the hair of the legs,
And will also remove the beard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It shall be in that day
That a man will keep alive a young cow and two sheep;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
It shall happen in that day,
That wherever there could be a thousand vines
Worth a thousand shekels of silver,
It will be for briers and thorns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With arrows and bows men will come there,
Because all the land will become briers and thorns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And to any hill which could be dug with the hoe,
You will not go there for fear of briers and thorns;
But it will become a range for oxen
And a place for sheep to roam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover the Lord said to me, “Take a large scroll, and write on it with a man’s pen concerning Maher-Shalal-Hash-Baz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will take for Myself faithful witnesses to record, Uriah the priest and Zechariah the son of Jeberechiah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I went to the prophetess, and she conceived and bore a son. Then the Lord said to me, “Call his name Maher-Shalal-Hash-Baz;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for before the child shall have knowledge to cry ‘My father’ and ‘My mother,’ the riches of Damascus and the spoil of Samaria will be taken away before the king of Assyria.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord also spoke to me again, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Now therefore, behold, the Lord brings up over them
The waters of the River, strong and mighty—
The king of Assyria and all his glory;
He will go up over all his channels
And go over all his banks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will pass through Judah,
He will overflow and pass over,
He will reach up to the neck;
And the stretching out of his wings
Will fill the breadth of Your land, O Immanuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Be shattered, O you peoples, and be broken in pieces!
Give ear, all you from far countries.
Gird yourselves, but be broken in pieces;
Gird yourselves, but be broken in pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord spoke thus to me with a strong hand, and instructed me that I should not walk in the way of this people, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Do not say, ‘A conspiracy,’
Concerning all that this people call a conspiracy,
Nor be afraid of their threats, nor be troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He will be as a sanctuary,
But a stone of stumbling and a rock of offense
To both the houses of Israel,
As a trap and a snare to the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Bind up the testimony,
Seal the law among my disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Here am I and the children whom the Lord has given me!
We are for signs and wonders in Israel
From the Lord of hosts,
Who dwells in Mount Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they say to you, “Seek those who are mediums and wizards, who whisper and mutter,” should not a people seek their God? Should they seek the dead on behalf of the living?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the law and to the testimony! If they do not speak according to this word, it is because there is no light in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will pass through it hard-pressed and hungry; and it shall happen, when they are hungry, that they will be enraged and curse their king and their God, and look upward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will look to the earth, and see trouble and darkness, gloom of anguish; and they will be driven into darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nevertheless the gloom will not be upon her who is distressed,
As when at first He lightly esteemed
The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali,
And afterward more heavily oppressed her,
By the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan,
In Galilee of the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The people who walked in darkness
Have seen a great light;
Those who dwelt in the land of the shadow of death,
Upon them a light has shined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have multiplied the nation
And increased its joy;
They rejoice before You
According to the joy of harvest,
As men rejoice when they divide the spoil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You have broken the yoke of his burden
And the staff of his shoulder,
The rod of his oppressor,
As in the day of Midian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For every warrior’s sandal from the noisy battle,
And garments rolled in blood,
Will be used for burning and fuel of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For unto us a Child is born,
Unto us a Son is given;
And the government will be upon His shoulder.
And His name will be called
Wonderful, Counselor, Mighty God,
Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of the increase of His government and peace
There will be no end,
Upon the throne of David and over His kingdom,
To order it and establish it with judgment and justice
From that time forward, even forever.
The zeal of the Lord of hosts will perform this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord sent a word against Jacob,
And it has fallen on Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the people will know—
Ephraim and the inhabitant of Samaria—
Who say in pride and arrogance of heart:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The bricks have fallen down,
But we will rebuild with hewn stones;
The sycamores are cut down,
But we will replace them with cedars.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the Lord shall set up
The adversaries of Rezin against him,
And spur his enemies on,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Syrians before and the Philistines behind;
And they shall devour Israel with an open mouth. 
For all this His anger is not turned away,
But His hand is stretched out still.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the people do not turn to Him who strikes them,
Nor do they seek the Lord of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the Lord will cut off head and tail from Israel,
Palm branch and bulrush in one day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The elder and honorable, he is the head;
The prophet who teaches lies, he is the tail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the leaders of this people cause them to err,
And those who are led by them are destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the Lord will have no joy in their young men,
Nor have mercy on their fatherless and widows;
For everyone is a hypocrite and an evildoer,
And every mouth speaks folly. 
For all this His anger is not turned away,
But His hand is stretched out still.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Through the wrath of the Lord of hosts
The land is burned up,
And the people shall be as fuel for the fire;
No man shall spare his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Manasseh shall devour Ephraim, and Ephraim Manasseh;
Together they shall be against Judah. 
For all this His anger is not turned away,
But His hand is stretched out still.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to those who decree unrighteous decrees,
Who write misfortune,
Which they have prescribed
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To rob the needy of justice,
And to take what is right from the poor of My people,
That widows may be their prey,
And that they may rob the fatherless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What will you do in the day of punishment,
And in the desolation which will come from afar?
To whom will you flee for help?
And where will you leave your glory?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Without Me they shall bow down among the prisoners,
And they shall fall among the slain.” 
For all this His anger is not turned away,
But His hand is stretched out still.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to Assyria, the rod of My anger
And the staff in whose hand is My indignation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will send him against an ungodly nation,
And against the people of My wrath
I will give him charge,
To seize the spoil, to take the prey,
And to tread them down like the mire of the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet he does not mean so,
Nor does his heart think so;
But it is in his heart to destroy,
And cut off not a few nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he says,
‘Are not my princes altogether kings?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is not Calno like Carchemish?
Is not Hamath like Arpad?
Is not Samaria like Damascus?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As my hand has found the kingdoms of the idols,
Whose carved images excelled those of Jerusalem and Samaria,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As I have done to Samaria and her idols,
Shall I not do also to Jerusalem and her idols?’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore it shall come to pass, when the Lord has performed all His work on Mount Zion and on Jerusalem, that He will say, “I will punish the fruit of the arrogant heart of the king of Assyria, and the glory of his haughty looks.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
My hand has found like a nest the riches of the people,
And as one gathers eggs that are left,
I have gathered all the earth;
And there was no one who moved his wing,
Nor opened his mouth with even a peep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall the ax boast itself against him who chops with it?
Or shall the saw exalt itself against him who saws with it?
As if a rod could wield itself against those who lift it up,
Or as if a staff could lift up, as if it were not wood!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the Lord, the Lord of hosts,
Will send leanness among his fat ones;
And under his glory
He will kindle a burning
Like the burning of a fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the Light of Israel will be for a fire,
And his Holy One for a flame;
It will burn and devour
His thorns and his briers in one day.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then the rest of the trees of his forest
Will be so few in number
That a child may write them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And it shall come to pass in that day
That the remnant of Israel,
And such as have escaped of the house of Jacob,
Will never again depend on him who defeated them,
But will depend on the Lord, the Holy One of Israel, in truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The remnant will return, the remnant of Jacob,
To the Mighty God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord God of hosts
Will make a determined end
In the midst of all the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord God of hosts: “O My people, who dwell in Zion, do not be afraid of the Assyrian. He shall strike you with a rod and lift up his staff against you, in the manner of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For yet a very little while and the indignation will cease, as will My anger in their destruction.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord of hosts will stir up a scourge for him like the slaughter of Midian at the rock of Oreb; as His rod was on the sea, so will He lift it up in the manner of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It shall come to pass in that day
That his burden will be taken away from your shoulder,
And his yoke from your neck,
And the yoke will be destroyed because of the anointing oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They have gone along the ridge,
They have taken up lodging at Geba.
Ramah is afraid,
Gibeah of Saul has fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lift up your voice,
O daughter of Gallim!
Cause it to be heard as far as Laish—
O poor Anathoth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Madmenah has fled,
The inhabitants of Gebim seek refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, the Lord,
The Lord of hosts,
Will lop off the bough with terror;
Those of high stature will be hewn down,
And the haughty will be humbled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will cut down the thickets of the forest with iron,
And Lebanon will fall by the Mighty One.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There shall come forth a Rod from the stem of Jesse,
And a Branch shall grow out of his roots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Spirit of the Lord shall rest upon Him,
The Spirit of wisdom and understanding,
The Spirit of counsel and might,
The Spirit of knowledge and of the fear of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But with righteousness He shall judge the poor,
And decide with equity for the meek of the earth;
He shall strike the earth with the rod of His mouth,
And with the breath of His lips He shall slay the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness shall be the belt of His loins,
And faithfulness the belt of His waist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The wolf also shall dwell with the lamb,
The leopard shall lie down with the young goat,
The calf and the young lion and the fatling together;
And a little child shall lead them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The nursing child shall play by the cobra’s hole,
And the weaned child shall put his hand in the viper’s den.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall not hurt nor destroy in all My holy mountain,
For the earth shall be full of the knowledge of the Lord
As the waters cover the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And in that day there shall be a Root of Jesse,
Who shall stand as a banner to the people;
For the Gentiles shall seek Him,
And His resting place shall be glorious.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It shall come to pass in that day
That the Lord shall set His hand again the second time
To recover the remnant of His people who are left,
From Assyria and Egypt,
From Pathros and Cush,
From Elam and Shinar,
From Hamath and the islands of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will set up a banner for the nations,
And will assemble the outcasts of Israel,
And gather together the dispersed of Judah
From the four corners of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also the envy of Ephraim shall depart,
And the adversaries of Judah shall be cut off;
Ephraim shall not envy Judah,
And Judah shall not harass Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will utterly destroy the tongue of the Sea of Egypt;
With His mighty wind He will shake His fist over the River,
And strike it in the seven streams,
And make men cross over dry-shod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There will be a highway for the remnant of His people
Who will be left from Assyria,
As it was for Israel
In the day that he came up from the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And in that day you will say:
“O Lord, I will praise You;
Though You were angry with me,
Your anger is turned away, and You comfort me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore with joy you will draw water
From the wells of salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And in that day you will say:
“Praise the Lord, call upon His name;
Declare His deeds among the peoples,
Make mention that His name is exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Cry out and shout, O inhabitant of Zion,
For great is the Holy One of Israel in your midst!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The burden against Babylon which Isaiah the son of Amoz saw.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The noise of a multitude in the mountains,
Like that of many people!
A tumultuous noise of the kingdoms of nations gathered together!
The Lord of hosts musters
The army for battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They come from a far country,
From the end of heaven—
The Lord and His weapons of indignation,
To destroy the whole land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wail, for the day of the Lord is at hand!
It will come as destruction from the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore all hands will be limp,
Every man’s heart will melt,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, the day of the Lord comes,
Cruel, with both wrath and fierce anger,
To lay the land desolate;
And He will destroy its sinners from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the stars of heaven and their constellations
Will not give their light;
The sun will be darkened in its going forth,
And the moon will not cause its light to shine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will punish the world for its evil,
And the wicked for their iniquity;
I will halt the arrogance of the proud,
And will lay low the haughtiness of the terrible.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make a mortal more rare than fine gold,
A man more than the golden wedge of Ophir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I will shake the heavens,
And the earth will move out of her place,
In the wrath of the Lord of hosts
And in the day of His fierce anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It shall be as the hunted gazelle,
And as a sheep that no man takes up;
Every man will turn to his own people,
And everyone will flee to his own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Everyone who is found will be thrust through,
And everyone who is captured will fall by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And Babylon, the glory of kingdoms,
The beauty of the Chaldeans’ pride,
Will be as when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It will never be inhabited,
Nor will it be settled from generation to generation;
Nor will the Arabian pitch tents there,
Nor will the shepherds make their sheepfolds there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But wild beasts of the desert will lie there,
And their houses will be full of owls;
Ostriches will dwell there,
And wild goats will caper there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hyenas will howl in their citadels,
And jackals in their pleasant palaces.
Her time is near to come,
And her days will not be prolonged.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord will have mercy on Jacob, and will still choose Israel, and settle them in their own land. The strangers will be joined with them, and they will cling to the house of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then people will take them and bring them to their place, and the house of Israel will possess them for servants and maids in the land of the Lord; they will take them captive whose captives they were, and rule over their oppressors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall come to pass in the day the Lord gives you rest from your sorrow, and from your fear and the hard bondage in which you were made to serve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that you will take up this proverb against the king of Babylon, and say:
“How the oppressor has ceased,
The golden city ceased!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has broken the staff of the wicked,
The scepter of the rulers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who struck the people in wrath with a continual stroke,
He who ruled the nations in anger,
Is persecuted and no one hinders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The whole earth is at rest and quiet;
They break forth into singing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed the cypress trees rejoice over you,
And the cedars of Lebanon,
Saying, ‘Since you were cut down,
No woodsman has come up against us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They all shall speak and say to you:
‘Have you also become as weak as we?
Have you become like us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your pomp is brought down to Sheol,
And the sound of your stringed instruments;
The maggot is spread under you,
And worms cover you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How you are fallen from heaven,
O Lucifer, son of the morning!
How you are cut down to the ground,
You who weakened the nations!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will ascend above the heights of the clouds,
I will be like the Most High.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet you shall be brought down to Sheol,
To the lowest depths of the Pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Those who see you will gaze at you,
And consider you, saying:
‘Is this the man who made the earth tremble,
Who shook kingdoms,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who made the world as a wilderness
And destroyed its cities,
Who did not open the house of his prisoners?’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But you are cast out of your grave
Like an abominable branch,
Like the garment of those who are slain,
Thrust through with a sword,
Who go down to the stones of the pit,
Like a corpse trodden underfoot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will not be joined with them in burial,
Because you have destroyed your land
And slain your people.
The brood of evildoers shall never be named.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Prepare slaughter for his children
Because of the iniquity of their fathers,
Lest they rise up and possess the land,
And fill the face of the world with cities.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For I will rise up against them,” says the Lord of hosts,
“And cut off from Babylon the name and remnant,
And offspring and posterity,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord of hosts has sworn, saying,
“Surely, as I have thought, so it shall come to pass,
And as I have purposed, so it shall stand:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That I will break the Assyrian in My land,
And on My mountains tread him underfoot.
Then his yoke shall be removed from them,
And his burden removed from their shoulders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the purpose that is purposed against the whole earth,
And this is the hand that is stretched out over all the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord of hosts has purposed,
And who will annul it?
His hand is stretched out,
And who will turn it back?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the burden which came in the year that King Ahaz died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Do not rejoice, all you of Philistia,
Because the rod that struck you is broken;
For out of the serpent’s roots will come forth a viper,
And its offspring will be a fiery flying serpent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The firstborn of the poor will feed,
And the needy will lie down in safety;
I will kill your roots with famine,
And it will slay your remnant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wail, O gate! Cry, O city!
All you of Philistia are dissolved;
For smoke will come from the north,
And no one will be alone in his appointed times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What will they answer the messengers of the nation?
That the Lord has founded Zion,
And the poor of His people shall take refuge in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The burden against Moab.
Because in the night Ar of Moab is laid waste
And destroyed,
Because in the night Kir of Moab is laid waste
And destroyed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has gone up to the temple and Dibon,
To the high places to weep.
Moab will wail over Nebo and over Medeba;
On all their heads will be baldness,
And every beard cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In their streets they will clothe themselves with sackcloth;
On the tops of their houses
And in their streets
Everyone will wail, weeping bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“My heart will cry out for Moab;
His fugitives shall flee to Zoar,
Like a three-year-old heifer.
For by the Ascent of Luhith
They will go up with weeping;
For in the way of Horonaim
They will raise up a cry of destruction,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the abundance they have gained,
And what they have laid up,
They will carry away to the Brook of the Willows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the cry has gone all around the borders of Moab,
Its wailing to Eglaim
And its wailing to Beer Elim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the waters of Dimon will be full of blood;
Because I will bring more upon Dimon,
Lions upon him who escapes from Moab,
And on the remnant of the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Send the lamb to the ruler of the land,
From Sela to the wilderness,
To the mount of the daughter of Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it shall be as a wandering bird thrown out of the nest;
So shall be the daughters of Moab at the fords of the Arnon.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let My outcasts dwell with you, O Moab;
Be a shelter to them from the face of the spoiler.
For the extortioner is at an end,
Devastation ceases,
The oppressors are consumed out of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
We have heard of the pride of Moab—
He is very proud—
Of his haughtiness and his pride and his wrath;
But his lies shall not be so.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For the fields of Heshbon languish,
And the vine of Sibmah;
The lords of the nations have broken down its choice plants,
Which have reached to Jazer
And wandered through the wilderness.
Her branches are stretched out,
They are gone over the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore my heart shall resound like a harp for Moab,
And my inner being for Kir Heres.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And it shall come to pass,
When it is seen that Moab is weary on the high place,
That he will come to his sanctuary to pray;
But he will not prevail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word which the Lord has spoken concerning Moab since that time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now the Lord has spoken, saying, “Within three years, as the years of a hired man, the glory of Moab will be despised with all that great multitude, and the remnant will be very small and feeble.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The burden against Damascus.
“Behold, Damascus will cease from being a city,
And it will be a ruinous heap.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The fortress also will cease from Ephraim,
The kingdom from Damascus,
And the remnant of Syria;
They will be as the glory of the children of Israel,”
Says the Lord of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“In that day it shall come to pass
That the glory of Jacob will wane,
And the fatness of his flesh grow lean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It shall be as when the harvester gathers the grain,
And reaps the heads with his arm;
It shall be as he who gathers heads of grain
In the Valley of Rephaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet gleaning grapes will be left in it,
Like the shaking of an olive tree,
Two or three olives at the top of the uppermost bough,
Four or five in its most fruitful branches,”
Says the Lord God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In that day a man will look to his Maker,
And his eyes will have respect for the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not look to the altars,
The work of his hands;
He will not respect what his fingers have made,
Nor the wooden images nor the incense altars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In that day his strong cities will be as a forsaken bough
And an uppermost branch,
Which they left because of the children of Israel;
And there will be desolation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because you have forgotten the God of your salvation,
And have not been mindful of the Rock of your stronghold,
Therefore you will plant pleasant plants
And set out foreign seedlings;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the day you will make your plant to grow,
And in the morning you will make your seed to flourish;
But the harvest will be a heap of ruins
In the day of grief and desperate sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to the multitude of many people
Who make a noise like the roar of the seas,
And to the rushing of nations
That make a rushing like the rushing of mighty waters!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The nations will rush like the rushing of many waters;
But God will rebuke them and they will flee far away,
And be chased like the chaff of the mountains before the wind,
Like a rolling thing before the whirlwind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then behold, at eventide, trouble!
And before the morning, he is no more.
This is the portion of those who plunder us,
And the lot of those who rob us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to the land shadowed with buzzing wings,
Which is beyond the rivers of Ethiopia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Which sends ambassadors by sea,
Even in vessels of reed on the waters, saying,
“Go, swift messengers, to a nation tall and smooth of skin,
To a people terrible from their beginning onward,
A nation powerful and treading down,
Whose land the rivers divide.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For so the Lord said to me,
“I will take My rest,
And I will look from My dwelling place
Like clear heat in sunshine,
Like a cloud of dew in the heat of harvest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For before the harvest, when the bud is perfect
And the sour grape is ripening in the flower,
He will both cut off the sprigs with pruning hooks
And take away and cut down the branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will be left together for the mountain birds of prey
And for the beasts of the earth;
The birds of prey will summer on them,
And all the beasts of the earth will winter on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In that time a present will be brought to the Lord of hosts
From a people tall and smooth of skin,
And from a people terrible from their beginning onward,
A nation powerful and treading down,
Whose land the rivers divide—
To the place of the name of the Lord of hosts,
To Mount Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The burden against Egypt.
Behold, the Lord rides on a swift cloud,
And will come into Egypt;
The idols of Egypt will totter at His presence,
And the heart of Egypt will melt in its midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will set Egyptians against Egyptians;
Everyone will fight against his brother,
And everyone against his neighbor,
City against city, kingdom against kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The spirit of Egypt will fail in its midst;
I will destroy their counsel,
And they will consult the idols and the charmers,
The mediums and the sorcerers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the Egyptians I will give
Into the hand of a cruel master,
And a fierce king will rule over them,”
Says the Lord, the Lord of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The waters will fail from the sea,
And the river will be wasted and dried up.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The papyrus reeds by the River, by the mouth of the River,
And everything sown by the River,
Will wither, be driven away, and be no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Moreover those who work in fine flax
And those who weave fine fabric will be ashamed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And its foundations will be broken.
All who make wages will be troubled of soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely the princes of Zoan are fools;
Pharaoh’s wise counselors give foolish counsel.
How do you say to Pharaoh, “I am the son of the wise,
The son of ancient kings?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where are they?
Where are your wise men?
Let them tell you now,
And let them know what the Lord of hosts has purposed against Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Neither will there be any work for Egypt,
Which the head or tail,
Palm branch or bulrush, may do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day Egypt will be like women, and will be afraid and fear because of the waving of the hand of the Lord of hosts, which He waves over it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the land of Judah will be a terror to Egypt; everyone who makes mention of it will be afraid in himself, because of the counsel of the Lord of hosts which He has determined against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day five cities in the land of Egypt will speak the language of Canaan and swear by the Lord of hosts; one will be called the City of Destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day there will be an altar to the Lord in the midst of the land of Egypt, and a pillar to the Lord at its border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it will be for a sign and for a witness to the Lord of hosts in the land of Egypt; for they will cry to the Lord because of the oppressors, and He will send them a Savior and a Mighty One, and He will deliver them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord will be known to Egypt, and the Egyptians will know the Lord in that day, and will make sacrifice and offering; yes, they will make a vow to the Lord and perform it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord will strike Egypt, He will strike and heal it; they will return to the Lord, and He will be entreated by them and heal them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day there will be a highway from Egypt to Assyria, and the Assyrian will come into Egypt and the Egyptian into Assyria, and the Egyptians will serve with the Assyrians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day Israel will be one of three with Egypt and Assyria—a blessing in the midst of the land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom the Lord of hosts shall bless, saying, “Blessed is Egypt My people, and Assyria the work of My hands, and Israel My inheritance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the year that Tartan came to Ashdod, when Sargon the king of Assyria sent him, and he fought against Ashdod and took it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at the same time the Lord spoke by Isaiah the son of Amoz, saying, “Go, and remove the sackcloth from your body, and take your sandals off your feet.” And he did so, walking naked and barefoot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “Just as My servant Isaiah has walked naked and barefoot three years for a sign and a wonder against Egypt and Ethiopia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so shall the king of Assyria lead away the Egyptians as prisoners and the Ethiopians as captives, young and old, naked and barefoot, with their buttocks uncovered, to the shame of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they shall be afraid and ashamed of Ethiopia their expectation and Egypt their glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the inhabitant of this territory will say in that day, ‘Surely such is our expectation, wherever we flee for help to be delivered from the king of Assyria; and how shall we escape?’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The burden against the Wilderness of the Sea.
As whirlwinds in the South pass through,
So it comes from the desert, from a terrible land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A distressing vision is declared to me;
The treacherous dealer deals treacherously,
And the plunderer plunders.
Go up, O Elam!
Besiege, O Media!
All its sighing I have made to cease.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
My heart wavered, fearfulness frightened me;
The night for which I longed He turned into fear for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Prepare the table,
Set a watchman in the tower,
Eat and drink.
Arise, you princes,
Anoint the shield!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thus has the Lord said to me:
“Go, set a watchman,
Let him declare what he sees.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he saw a chariot with a pair of horsemen,
A chariot of donkeys, and a chariot of camels,
And he listened earnestly with great care.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And look, here comes a chariot of men with a pair of horsemen!”
Then he answered and said,
“Babylon is fallen, is fallen!
And all the carved images of her gods
He has broken to the ground.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, my threshing and the grain of my floor!
That which I have heard from the Lord of hosts,
The God of Israel,
I have declared to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The burden against Dumah.
He calls to me out of Seir,
“Watchman, what of the night?
Watchman, what of the night?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The watchman said,
“The morning comes, and also the night.
If you will inquire, inquire;
Return! Come back!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The burden against Arabia.
In the forest in Arabia you will lodge,
O you traveling companies of Dedanites.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For they fled from the swords, from the drawn sword,
From the bent bow, and from the distress of war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus the Lord has said to me: “Within a year, according to the year of a hired man, all the glory of Kedar will fail;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the remainder of the number of archers, the mighty men of the people of Kedar, will be diminished; for the Lord God of Israel has spoken it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The burden against the Valley of Vision.
What ails you now, that you have all gone up to the housetops,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You who are full of noise,
A tumultuous city, a joyous city?
Your slain men are not slain with the sword,
Nor dead in battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I said, “Look away from me,
I will weep bitterly;
Do not labor to comfort me
Because of the plundering of the daughter of my people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it is a day of trouble and treading down and perplexity
By the Lord God of hosts
In the Valley of Vision—
Breaking down the walls
And of crying to the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Elam bore the quiver
With chariots of men and horsemen,
And Kir uncovered the shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It shall come to pass that your choicest valleys
Shall be full of chariots,
And the horsemen shall set themselves in array at the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He removed the protection of Judah.
You looked in that day to the armor of the House of the Forest;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You numbered the houses of Jerusalem,
And the houses you broke down
To fortify the wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You also made a reservoir between the two walls
For the water of the old pool.
But you did not look to its Maker,
Nor did you have respect for Him who fashioned it long ago.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And in that day the Lord God of hosts
Called for weeping and for mourning,
For baldness and for girding with sackcloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But instead, joy and gladness,
Slaying oxen and killing sheep,
Eating meat and drinking wine:
“Let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then it was revealed in my hearing by the Lord of hosts,
“Surely for this iniquity there will be no atonement for you,
Even to your death,” says the Lord God of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord God of hosts:
“Go, proceed to this steward,
To Shebna, who is over the house, and say:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘What have you here, and whom have you here,
That you have hewn a sepulcher here,
As he who hews himself a sepulcher on high,
Who carves a tomb for himself in a rock?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, the Lord will throw you away violently,
O mighty man,
And will surely seize you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will surely turn violently and toss you like a ball
Into a large country;
There you shall die, and there your glorious chariots
Shall be the shame of your master’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I will drive you out of your office,
And from your position he will pull you down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Then it shall be in that day,
That I will call My servant Eliakim the son of Hilkiah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will clothe him with your robe
And strengthen him with your belt;
I will commit your responsibility into his hand.
He shall be a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem
And to the house of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will fasten him as a peg in a secure place,
And he will become a glorious throne to his father’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘They will hang on him all the glory of his father’s house, the offspring and the posterity, all vessels of small quantity, from the cups to all the pitchers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day,’ says the Lord of hosts, ‘the peg that is fastened in the secure place will be removed and be cut down and fall, and the burden that was on it will be cut off; for the Lord has spoken.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The burden against Tyre.
Wail, you ships of Tarshish!
For it is laid waste,
So that there is no house, no harbor;
From the land of Cyprus it is revealed to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be still, you inhabitants of the coastland,
You merchants of Sidon,
Whom those who cross the sea have filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
When the report reaches Egypt,
They also will be in agony at the report of Tyre.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cross over to Tarshish;
Wail, you inhabitants of the coastland!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is this your joyous city,
Whose antiquity is from ancient days,
Whose feet carried her far off to dwell?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who has taken this counsel against Tyre, the crowning city,
Whose merchants are princes,
Whose traders are the honorable of the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord of hosts has purposed it,
To bring to dishonor the pride of all glory,
To bring into contempt all the honorable of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He stretched out His hand over the sea,
He shook the kingdoms;
The Lord has given a commandment against Canaan
To destroy its strongholds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And He said, “You will rejoice no more,
O you oppressed virgin daughter of Sidon.
Arise, cross over to Cyprus;
There also you will have no rest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, the land of the Chaldeans,
This people which was not;
Assyria founded it for wild beasts of the desert.
They set up its towers,
They raised up its palaces,
And brought it to ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wail, you ships of Tarshish!
For your strength is laid waste.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it shall come to pass in that day that Tyre will be forgotten seventy years, according to the days of one king. At the end of seventy years it will happen to Tyre as in the song of the harlot:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Take a harp, go about the city,
You forgotten harlot;
Make sweet melody, sing many songs,
That you may be remembered.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be, at the end of seventy years, that the Lord will deal with Tyre. She will return to her hire, and commit fornication with all the kingdoms of the world on the face of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her gain and her pay will be set apart for the Lord; it will not be treasured nor laid up, for her gain will be for those who dwell before the Lord, to eat sufficiently, and for fine clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, the Lord makes the earth empty and makes it waste,
Distorts its surface
And scatters abroad its inhabitants.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The land shall be entirely emptied and utterly plundered,
For the Lord has spoken this word.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The earth is also defiled under its inhabitants,
Because they have transgressed the laws,
Changed the ordinance,
Broken the everlasting covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the curse has devoured the earth,
And those who dwell in it are desolate.
Therefore the inhabitants of the earth are burned,
And few men are left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The new wine fails, the vine languishes,
All the merry-hearted sigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mirth of the tambourine ceases,
The noise of the jubilant ends,
The joy of the harp ceases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall not drink wine with a song;
Strong drink is bitter to those who drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The city of confusion is broken down;
Every house is shut up, so that none may go in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a cry for wine in the streets,
All joy is darkened,
The mirth of the land is gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the city desolation is left,
And the gate is stricken with destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When it shall be thus in the midst of the land among the people,
It shall be like the shaking of an olive tree,
Like the gleaning of grapes when the vintage is done.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore glorify the Lord in the dawning light,
The name of the Lord God of Israel in the coastlands of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the ends of the earth we have heard songs:
“Glory to the righteous!”
But I said, “I am ruined, ruined!
Woe to me!
The treacherous dealers have dealt treacherously,
Indeed, the treacherous dealers have dealt very treacherously.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fear and the pit and the snare
Are upon you, O inhabitant of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And it shall be
That he who flees from the noise of the fear
Shall fall into the pit,
And he who comes up from the midst of the pit
Shall be caught in the snare;
For the windows from on high are open,
And the foundations of the earth are shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth is violently broken,
The earth is split open,
The earth is shaken exceedingly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth shall reel to and fro like a drunkard,
And shall totter like a hut;
Its transgression shall be heavy upon it,
And it will fall, and not rise again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It shall come to pass in that day
That the Lord will punish on high the host of exalted ones,
And on the earth the kings of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will be gathered together,
As prisoners are gathered in the pit,
And will be shut up in the prison;
After many days they will be punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the moon will be disgraced
And the sun ashamed;
For the Lord of hosts will reign
On Mount Zion and in Jerusalem
And before His elders, gloriously.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, You are my God.
I will exalt You,
I will praise Your name,
For You have done wonderful things;
Your counsels of old are faithfulness and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You have made a city a ruin,
A fortified city a ruin,
A palace of foreigners to be a city no more;
It will never be rebuilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the strong people will glorify You;
The city of the terrible nations will fear You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You have been a strength to the poor,
A strength to the needy in his distress,
A refuge from the storm,
A shade from the heat;
For the blast of the terrible ones is as a storm against the wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will reduce the noise of aliens,
As heat in a dry place;
As heat in the shadow of a cloud,
The song of the terrible ones will be diminished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And in this mountain
The Lord of hosts will make for all people
A feast of choice pieces,
A feast of wines on the lees,
Of fat things full of marrow,
Of well-refined wines on the lees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And He will destroy on this mountain
The surface of the covering cast over all people,
And the veil that is spread over all nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For on this mountain the hand of the Lord will rest,
And Moab shall be trampled down under Him,
As straw is trampled down for the refuse heap.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And He will spread out His hands in their midst
As a swimmer reaches out to swim,
And He will bring down their pride
Together with the trickery of their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fortress of the high fort of your walls
He will bring down, lay low,
And bring to the ground, down to the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Open the gates,
That the righteous nation which keeps the truth may enter in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will keep him in perfect peace,
Whose mind is stayed on You,
Because he trusts in You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trust in the Lord forever,
For in Yah, the Lord, is everlasting strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He brings down those who dwell on high,
The lofty city;
He lays it low,
He lays it low to the ground,
He brings it down to the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The foot shall tread it down—
The feet of the poor
And the steps of the needy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, in the way of Your judgments,
O Lord, we have waited for You;
The desire of our soul is for Your name
And for the remembrance of You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With my soul I have desired You in the night,
Yes, by my spirit within me I will seek You early;
For when Your judgments are in the earth,
The inhabitants of the world will learn righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let grace be shown to the wicked,
Yet he will not learn righteousness;
In the land of uprightness he will deal unjustly,
And will not behold the majesty of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, when Your hand is lifted up, they will not see.
But they will see and be ashamed
For their envy of people;
Yes, the fire of Your enemies shall devour them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, You will establish peace for us,
For You have also done all our works in us.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They are dead, they will not live;
They are deceased, they will not rise.
Therefore You have punished and destroyed them,
And made all their memory to perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, in trouble they have visited You,
They poured out a prayer when Your chastening was upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a woman with child
Is in pain and cries out in her pangs,
When she draws near the time of her delivery,
So have we been in Your sight, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Come, my people, enter your chambers,
And shut your doors behind you;
Hide yourself, as it were, for a little moment,
Until the indignation is past.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For behold, the Lord comes out of His place
To punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity;
The earth will also disclose her blood,
And will no more cover her slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In that day the Lord with His severe sword, great and strong,
Will punish Leviathan the fleeing serpent,
Leviathan that twisted serpent;
And He will slay the reptile that is in the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In that day sing to her,
“A vineyard of red wine!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I, the Lord, keep it,
I water it every moment;
Lest any hurt it,
I keep it night and day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fury is not in Me.
Who would set briers and thorns
Against Me in battle?
I would go through them,
I would burn them together.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Has He struck Israel as He struck those who struck him?
Or has He been slain according to the slaughter of those who were slain by Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In measure, by sending it away,
You contended with it.
He removes it by His rough wind
In the day of the east wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore by this the iniquity of Jacob will be covered;
And this is all the fruit of taking away his sin:
When he makes all the stones of the altar
Like chalkstones that are beaten to dust,
Wooden images and incense altars shall not stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet the fortified city will be desolate,
The habitation forsaken and left like a wilderness;
There the calf will feed, and there it will lie down
And consume its branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And it shall come to pass in that day
That the Lord will thresh,
From the channel of the River to the Brook of Egypt;
And you will be gathered one by one,
O you children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So it shall be in that day:
The great trumpet will be blown;
They will come, who are about to perish in the land of Assyria,
And they who are outcasts in the land of Egypt,
And shall worship the Lord in the holy mount at Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to the crown of pride, to the drunkards of Ephraim,
Whose glorious beauty is a fading flower
Which is at the head of the verdant valleys,
To those who are overcome with wine!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, the Lord has a mighty and strong one,
Like a tempest of hail and a destroying storm,
Like a flood of mighty waters overflowing,
Who will bring them down to the earth with His hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The crown of pride, the drunkards of Ephraim,
Will be trampled underfoot;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the glorious beauty is a fading flower
Which is at the head of the verdant valley,
Like the first fruit before the summer,
Which an observer sees;
He eats it up while it is still in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In that day the Lord of hosts will be
For a crown of glory and a diadem of beauty
To the remnant of His people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a spirit of justice to him who sits in judgment,
And for strength to those who turn back the battle at the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For all tables are full of vomit and filth;
No place is clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Whom will he teach knowledge?
And whom will he make to understand the message?
Those just weaned from milk?
Those just drawn from the breasts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For precept must be upon precept, precept upon precept,
Line upon line, line upon line,
Here a little, there a little.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For with stammering lips and another tongue
He will speak to this people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To whom He said, “This is the rest with which
You may cause the weary to rest,”
And, “This is the refreshing”;
Yet they would not hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the word of the Lord was to them,
“Precept upon precept, precept upon precept,
Line upon line, line upon line,
Here a little, there a little,”
That they might go and fall backward, and be broken
And snared and caught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore hear the word of the Lord, you scornful men,
Who rule this people who are in Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because you have said, “We have made a covenant with death,
And with Sheol we are in agreement.
When the overflowing scourge passes through,
It will not come to us,
For we have made lies our refuge,
And under falsehood we have hidden ourselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore thus says the Lord God:
“Behold, I lay in Zion a stone for a foundation,
A tried stone, a precious cornerstone, a sure foundation;
Whoever believes will not act hastily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also I will make justice the measuring line,
And righteousness the plummet;
The hail will sweep away the refuge of lies,
And the waters will overflow the hiding place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your covenant with death will be annulled,
And your agreement with Sheol will not stand;
When the overflowing scourge passes through,
Then you will be trampled down by it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For the bed is too short to stretch out on,
And the covering so narrow that one cannot wrap himself in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord will rise up as at Mount Perazim,
He will be angry as in the Valley of Gibeon—
That He may do His work, His awesome work,
And bring to pass His act, His unusual act.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now therefore, do not be mockers,
Lest your bonds be made strong;
For I have heard from the Lord God of hosts,
A destruction determined even upon the whole earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give ear and hear my voice,
Listen and hear my speech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does the plowman keep plowing all day to sow?
Does he keep turning his soil and breaking the clods?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he has leveled its surface,
Does he not sow the black cummin
