And scatter the cummin,
Plant the wheat in rows,
The barley in the appointed place,
And the spelt in its place?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He instructs him in right judgment,
His God teaches him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the black cummin is not threshed with a threshing sledge,
Nor is a cartwheel rolled over the cummin;
But the black cummin is beaten out with a stick,
And the cummin with a rod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bread flour must be ground;
Therefore he does not thresh it forever,
Break it with his cartwheel,
Or crush it with his horsemen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This also comes from the Lord of hosts,
Who is wonderful in counsel and excellent in guidance.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will encamp against you all around,
I will lay siege against you with a mound,
And I will raise siegeworks against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Moreover the multitude of your foes
Shall be like fine dust,
And the multitude of the terrible ones
Like chaff that passes away;
Yes, it shall be in an instant, suddenly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will be punished by the Lord of hosts
With thunder and earthquake and great noise,
With storm and tempest
And the flame of devouring fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The multitude of all the nations who fight against Ariel,
Even all who fight against her and her fortress,
And distress her,
Shall be as a dream of a night vision.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Pause and wonder!
Blind yourselves and be blind!
They are drunk, but not with wine;
They stagger, but not with intoxicating drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord has poured out on you
The spirit of deep sleep,
And has closed your eyes, namely, the prophets;
And He has covered your heads, namely, the seers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The whole vision has become to you like the words of a book that is sealed, which men deliver to one who is literate, saying, “Read this, please.”
And he says, “I cannot, for it is sealed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the book is delivered to one who is illiterate, saying, “Read this, please.”
And he says, “I am not literate.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the Lord said:
“Inasmuch as these people draw near with their mouths
And honor Me with their lips,
But have removed their hearts far from Me,
And their fear toward Me is taught by the commandment of men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, behold, I will again do a marvelous work
Among this people,
A marvelous work and a wonder;
For the wisdom of their wise men shall perish,
And the understanding of their prudent men shall be hidden.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Surely you have things turned around!
Shall the potter be esteemed as the clay;
For shall the thing made say of him who made it,
“He did not make me”?
Or shall the thing formed say of him who formed it,
“He has no understanding”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it not yet a very little while
Till Lebanon shall be turned into a fruitful field,
And the fruitful field be esteemed as a forest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In that day the deaf shall hear the words of the book,
And the eyes of the blind shall see out of obscurity and out of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The humble also shall increase their joy in the Lord,
And the poor among men shall rejoice
In the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the terrible one is brought to nothing,
The scornful one is consumed,
And all who watch for iniquity are cut off—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who make a man an offender by a word,
And lay a snare for him who reproves in the gate,
And turn aside the just by empty words.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But when he sees his children,
The work of My hands, in his midst,
They will hallow My name,
And hallow the Holy One of Jacob,
And fear the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These also who erred in spirit will come to understanding,
And those who complained will learn doctrine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to the rebellious children,” says the Lord,
“Who take counsel, but not of Me,
And who devise plans, but not of My Spirit,
That they may add sin to sin;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who walk to go down to Egypt,
And have not asked My advice,
To strengthen themselves in the strength of Pharaoh,
And to trust in the shadow of Egypt!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the strength of Pharaoh
Shall be your shame,
And trust in the shadow of Egypt
Shall be your humiliation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For his princes were at Zoan,
And his ambassadors came to Hanes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They were all ashamed of a people who could not benefit them,
Or be help or benefit,
But a shame and also a reproach.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The burden against the beasts of the South.
Through a land of trouble and anguish,
From which came the lioness and lion,
The viper and fiery flying serpent,
They will carry their riches on the backs of young donkeys,
And their treasures on the humps of camels,
To a people who shall not profit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Egyptians shall help in vain and to no purpose.
Therefore I have called her
Rahab-Hem-Shebeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now go, write it before them on a tablet,
And note it on a scroll,
That it may be for time to come,
Forever and ever:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Get out of the way,
Turn aside from the path,
Cause the Holy One of Israel
To cease from before us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore thus says the Holy One of Israel:
“Because you despise this word,
And trust in oppression and perversity,
And rely on them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore this iniquity shall be to you
Like a breach ready to fall,
A bulge in a high wall,
Whose breaking comes suddenly, in an instant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And He shall break it like the breaking of the potter’s vessel,
Which is broken in pieces;
He shall not spare.
So there shall not be found among its fragments
A shard to take fire from the hearth,
Or to take water from the cistern.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thus says the Lord God, the Holy One of Israel:
“In returning and rest you shall be saved;
In quietness and confidence shall be your strength.”
But you would not,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And you said, “No, for we will flee on horses”—
Therefore you shall flee!
And, “We will ride on swift horses”—
Therefore those who pursue you shall be swift!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One thousand shall flee at the threat of one,
At the threat of five you shall flee,
Till you are left as a pole on top of a mountain
And as a banner on a hill.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And though the Lord gives you
The bread of adversity and the water of affliction,
Yet your teachers will not be moved into a corner anymore,
But your eyes shall see your teachers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your ears shall hear a word behind you, saying,
“This is the way, walk in it,”
Whenever you turn to the right hand
Or whenever you turn to the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will also defile the covering of your images of silver,
And the ornament of your molded images of gold.
You will throw them away as an unclean thing;
You will say to them, “Get away!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then He will give the rain for your seed
With which you sow the ground,
And bread of the increase of the earth;
It will be fat and plentiful.
In that day your cattle will feed
In large pastures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Likewise the oxen and the young donkeys that work the ground
Will eat cured fodder,
Which has been winnowed with the shovel and fan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There will be on every high mountain
And on every high hill
Rivers and streams of waters,
In the day of the great slaughter,
When the towers fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moreover the light of the moon will be as the light of the sun,
And the light of the sun will be sevenfold,
As the light of seven days,
In the day that the Lord binds up the bruise of His people
And heals the stroke of their wound.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, the name of the Lord comes from afar,
Burning with His anger,
And His burden is heavy;
His lips are full of indignation,
And His tongue like a devouring fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His breath is like an overflowing stream,
Which reaches up to the neck,
To sift the nations with the sieve of futility;
And there shall be a bridle in the jaws of the people,
Causing them to err.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You shall have a song
As in the night when a holy festival is kept,
And gladness of heart as when one goes with a flute,
To come into the mountain of the Lord,
To the Mighty One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will cause His glorious voice to be heard,
And show the descent of His arm,
With the indignation of His anger
And the flame of a devouring fire,
With scattering, tempest, and hailstones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For through the voice of the Lord
Assyria will be beaten down,
As He strikes with the rod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And in every place where the staff of punishment passes,
Which the Lord lays on him,
It will be with tambourines and harps;
And in battles of brandishing He will fight with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to those who go down to Egypt for help,
And rely on horses,
Who trust in chariots because they are many,
And in horsemen because they are very strong,
But who do not look to the Holy One of Israel,
Nor seek the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet He also is wise and will bring disaster,
And will not call back His words,
But will arise against the house of evildoers,
And against the help of those who work iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For thus the Lord has spoken to me:
“As a lion roars,
And a young lion over his prey
(When a multitude of shepherds is summoned against him,
He will not be afraid of their voice
Nor be disturbed by their noise),
So the Lord of hosts will come down
To fight for Mount Zion and for its hill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like birds flying about,
So will the Lord of hosts defend Jerusalem.
Defending, He will also deliver it;
Passing over, He will preserve it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Return to Him against whom the children of Israel have deeply revolted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in that day every man shall throw away his idols of silver and his idols of gold—sin, which your own hands have made for yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Then Assyria shall fall by a sword not of man,
And a sword not of mankind shall devour him.
But he shall flee from the sword,
And his young men shall become forced labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall cross over to his stronghold for fear,
And his princes shall be afraid of the banner,”
Says the Lord,
Whose fire is in Zion
And whose furnace is in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, a king will reign in righteousness,
And princes will rule with justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man will be as a hiding place from the wind,
And a cover from the tempest,
As rivers of water in a dry place,
As the shadow of a great rock in a weary land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eyes of those who see will not be dim,
And the ears of those who hear will listen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also the heart of the rash will understand knowledge,
And the tongue of the stammerers will be ready to speak plainly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The foolish person will no longer be called generous,
Nor the miser said to be bountiful;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the foolish person will speak foolishness,
And his heart will work iniquity:
To practice ungodliness,
To utter error against the Lord,
To keep the hungry unsatisfied,
And he will cause the drink of the thirsty to fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also the schemes of the schemer are evil;
He devises wicked plans
To destroy the poor with lying words,
Even when the needy speaks justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But a generous man devises generous things,
And by generosity he shall stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rise up, you women who are at ease,
Hear my voice;
You complacent daughters,
Give ear to my speech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In a year and some days
You will be troubled, you complacent women;
For the vintage will fail,
The gathering will not come.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
People shall mourn upon their breasts
For the pleasant fields, for the fruitful vine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On the land of my people will come up thorns and briers,
Yes, on all the happy homes in the joyous city;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because the palaces will be forsaken,
The bustling city will be deserted.
The forts and towers will become lairs forever,
A joy of wild donkeys, a pasture of flocks—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Until the Spirit is poured upon us from on high,
And the wilderness becomes a fruitful field,
And the fruitful field is counted as a forest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then justice will dwell in the wilderness,
And righteousness remain in the fruitful field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The work of righteousness will be peace,
And the effect of righteousness, quietness and assurance forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My people will dwell in a peaceful habitation,
In secure dwellings, and in quiet resting places,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though hail comes down on the forest,
And the city is brought low in humiliation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are you who sow beside all waters,
Who send out freely the feet of the ox and the donkey.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, be gracious to us;
We have waited for You.
Be their arm every morning,
Our salvation also in the time of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At the noise of the tumult the people shall flee;
When You lift Yourself up, the nations shall be scattered;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Your plunder shall be gathered
Like the gathering of the caterpillar;
As the running to and fro of locusts,
He shall run upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is exalted, for He dwells on high;
He has filled Zion with justice and righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Surely their valiant ones shall cry outside,
The ambassadors of peace shall weep bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The highways lie waste,
The traveling man ceases.
He has broken the covenant,
He has despised the cities,
He regards no man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth mourns and languishes,
Lebanon is shamed and shriveled;
Sharon is like a wilderness,
And Bashan and Carmel shake off their fruits.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And the people shall be like the burnings of lime;
Like thorns cut up they shall be burned in the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, you who are afar off, what I have done;
And you who are near, acknowledge My might.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sinners in Zion are afraid;
Fearfulness has seized the hypocrites:
“Who among us shall dwell with the devouring fire?
Who among us shall dwell with everlasting burnings?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who walks righteously and speaks uprightly,
He who despises the gain of oppressions,
Who gestures with his hands, refusing bribes,
Who stops his ears from hearing of bloodshed,
And shuts his eyes from seeing evil:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your eyes will see the King in His beauty;
They will see the land that is very far off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your heart will meditate on terror:
“Where is the scribe?
Where is he who weighs?
Where is he who counts the towers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will not see a fierce people,
A people of obscure speech, beyond perception,
Of a stammering tongue that you cannot understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But there the majestic Lord will be for us
A place of broad rivers and streams,
In which no galley with oars will sail,
Nor majestic ships pass by
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your tackle is loosed,
They could not strengthen their mast,
They could not spread the sail. 
Then the prey of great plunder is divided;
The lame take the prey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the inhabitant will not say, “I am sick”;
The people who dwell in it will be forgiven their iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come near, you nations, to hear;
And heed, you people!
Let the earth hear, and all that is in it,
The world and all things that come forth from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the indignation of the Lord is against all nations,
And His fury against all their armies;
He has utterly destroyed them,
He has given them over to the slaughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
All the host of heaven shall be dissolved,
And the heavens shall be rolled up like a scroll;
All their host shall fall down
As the leaf falls from the vine,
And as fruit falling from a fig tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The sword of the Lord is filled with blood,
It is made overflowing with fatness,
With the blood of lambs and goats,
With the fat of the kidneys of rams.
For the Lord has a sacrifice in Bozrah,
And a great slaughter in the land of Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wild oxen shall come down with them,
And the young bulls with the mighty bulls;
Their land shall be soaked with blood,
And their dust saturated with fatness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it is the day of the Lord’s vengeance,
The year of recompense for the cause of Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But the pelican and the porcupine shall possess it,
Also the owl and the raven shall dwell in it.
And He shall stretch out over it
The line of confusion and the stones of emptiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall call its nobles to the kingdom,
But none shall be there, and all its princes shall be nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And thorns shall come up in its palaces,
Nettles and brambles in its fortresses;
It shall be a habitation of jackals,
A courtyard for ostriches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wild beasts of the desert shall also meet with the jackals,
And the wild goat shall bleat to its companion;
Also the night creature shall rest there,
And find for herself a place of rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There the arrow snake shall make her nest and lay eggs
And hatch, and gather them under her shadow;
There also shall the hawks be gathered,
Every one with her mate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Search from the book of the Lord, and read:
Not one of these shall fail;
Not one shall lack her mate.
For My mouth has commanded it, and His Spirit has gathered them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has cast the lot for them,
And His hand has divided it among them with a measuring line.
They shall possess it forever;
From generation to generation they shall dwell in it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wilderness and the wasteland shall be glad for them,
And the desert shall rejoice and blossom as the rose;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It shall blossom abundantly and rejoice,
Even with joy and singing.
The glory of Lebanon shall be given to it,
The excellence of Carmel and Sharon.
They shall see the glory of the Lord,
The excellency of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Strengthen the weak hands,
And make firm the feeble knees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say to those who are fearful-hearted,
“Be strong, do not fear!
Behold, your God will come with vengeance,
With the recompense of God;
He will come and save you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened,
And the ears of the deaf shall be unstopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the lame shall leap like a deer,
And the tongue of the dumb sing.
For waters shall burst forth in the wilderness,
And streams in the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The parched ground shall become a pool,
And the thirsty land springs of water;
In the habitation of jackals, where each lay,
There shall be grass with reeds and rushes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A highway shall be there, and a road,
And it shall be called the Highway of Holiness.
The unclean shall not pass over it,
But it shall be for others.
Whoever walks the road, although a fool,
Shall not go astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No lion shall be there,
Nor shall any ravenous beast go up on it;
It shall not be found there.
But the redeemed shall walk there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the ransomed of the Lord shall return,
And come to Zion with singing,
With everlasting joy on their heads.
They shall obtain joy and gladness,
And sorrow and sighing shall flee away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass in the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah that Sennacherib king of Assyria came up against all the fortified cities of Judah and took them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king of Assyria sent the Rabshakeh with a great army from Lachish to King Hezekiah at Jerusalem. And he stood by the aqueduct from the upper pool, on the highway to the Fuller’s Field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph, the recorder, came out to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Rabshakeh said to them, “Say now to Hezekiah, ‘Thus says the great king, the king of Assyria: “What confidence is this in which you trust?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say you speak of having plans and power for war; but they are mere words. Now in whom do you trust, that you rebel against me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look! You are trusting in the staff of this broken reed, Egypt, on which if a man leans, it will go into his hand and pierce it. So is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all who trust in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if you say to me, ‘We trust in the Lord our God,’ is it not He whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah has taken away, and said to Judah and Jerusalem, ‘You shall worship before this altar’?” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, I urge you, give a pledge to my master the king of Assyria, and I will give you two thousand horses—if you are able on your part to put riders on them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How then will you repel one captain of the least of my master’s servants, and put your trust in Egypt for chariots and horsemen?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have I now come up without the Lord against this land to destroy it? The Lord said to me, ‘Go up against this land, and destroy it.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Eliakim, Shebna, and Joah said to the Rabshakeh, “Please speak to your servants in Aramaic, for we understand it; and do not speak to us in Hebrew in the hearing of the people who are on the wall.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Rabshakeh said, “Has my master sent me to your master and to you to speak these words, and not to the men who sit on the wall, who will eat and drink their own waste with you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Rabshakeh stood and called out with a loud voice in Hebrew, and said, “Hear the words of the great king, the king of Assyria!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the king: ‘Do not let Hezekiah deceive you, for he will not be able to deliver you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor let Hezekiah make you trust in the Lord, saying, “The Lord will surely deliver us; this city will not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not listen to Hezekiah; for thus says the king of Assyria: ‘Make peace with me by a present and come out to me; and every one of you eat from his own vine and every one from his own fig tree, and every one of you drink the waters of his own cistern;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of grain and new wine, a land of bread and vineyards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beware lest Hezekiah persuade you, saying, “The Lord will deliver us.” Has any one of the gods of the nations delivered its land from the hand of the king of Assyria?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? Indeed, have they delivered Samaria from my hand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who among all the gods of these lands have delivered their countries from my hand, that the Lord should deliver Jerusalem from my hand?’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they held their peace and answered him not a word; for the king’s commandment was, “Do not answer him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph, the recorder, came to Hezekiah with their clothes torn, and told him the words of the Rabshakeh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so it was, when King Hezekiah heard it, that he tore his clothes, covered himself with sackcloth, and went into the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he sent Eliakim, who was over the household, Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth, to Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, “Thus says Hezekiah: ‘This day is a day of trouble and rebuke and blasphemy; for the children have come to birth, but there is no strength to bring them forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It may be that the Lord your God will hear the words of the Rabshakeh, whom his master the king of Assyria has sent to reproach the living God, and will rebuke the words which the Lord your God has heard. Therefore lift up your prayer for the remnant that is left.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the servants of King Hezekiah came to Isaiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Isaiah said to them, “Thus you shall say to your master, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Do not be afraid of the words which you have heard, with which the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely I will send a spirit upon him, and he shall hear a rumor and return to his own land; and I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Rabshakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria warring against Libnah, for he heard that he had departed from Lachish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king heard concerning Tirhakah king of Ethiopia, “He has come out to make war with you.” So when he heard it, he sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus you shall speak to Hezekiah king of Judah, saying: ‘Do not let your God in whom you trust deceive you, saying, “Jerusalem shall not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look! You have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands by utterly destroying them; and shall you be delivered?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have the gods of the nations delivered those whom my fathers have destroyed, Gozan and Haran and Rezeph, and the people of Eden who were in Telassar?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where is the king of Hamath, the king of Arpad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivah?’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Hezekiah received the letter from the hand of the messengers, and read it; and Hezekiah went up to the house of the Lord, and spread it before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hezekiah prayed to the Lord, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O Lord of hosts, God of Israel, the One who dwells between the cherubim, You are God, You alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth. You have made heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Incline Your ear, O Lord, and hear; open Your eyes, O Lord, and see; and hear all the words of Sennacherib, which he has sent to reproach the living God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, Lord, the kings of Assyria have laid waste all the nations and their lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and have cast their gods into the fire; for they were not gods, but the work of men’s hands—wood and stone. Therefore they destroyed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, O Lord our God, save us from his hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that You are the Lord, You alone.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent to Hezekiah, saying, “Thus says the Lord God of Israel, ‘Because you have prayed to Me against Sennacherib king of Assyria,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
this is the word which the Lord has spoken concerning him:
“The virgin, the daughter of Zion,
Has despised you, laughed you to scorn;
The daughter of Jerusalem
Has shaken her head behind your back!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Whom have you reproached and blasphemed?
Against whom have you raised your voice,
And lifted up your eyes on high?
Against the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By your servants you have reproached the Lord,
And said, ‘By the multitude of my chariots
I have come up to the height of the mountains,
To the limits of Lebanon;
I will cut down its tall cedars
And its choice cypress trees;
I will enter its farthest height,
To its fruitful forest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have dug and drunk water,
And with the soles of my feet I have dried up
All the brooks of defense.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Did you not hear long ago
How I made it,
From ancient times that I formed it?
Now I have brought it to pass,
That you should be
For crushing fortified cities into heaps of ruins.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“But I know your dwelling place,
Your going out and your coming in,
And your rage against Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because your rage against Me and your tumult
Have come up to My ears,
Therefore I will put My hook in your nose
And My bridle in your lips,
And I will turn you back
By the way which you came.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“This shall be a sign to you:
You shall eat this year such as grows of itself,
And the second year what springs from the same;
Also in the third year sow and reap,
Plant vineyards and eat the fruit of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the remnant who have escaped of the house of Judah
Shall again take root downward,
And bear fruit upward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For out of Jerusalem shall go a remnant,
And those who escape from Mount Zion.
The zeal of the Lord of hosts will do this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore thus says the Lord concerning the king of Assyria:
‘He shall not come into this city,
Nor shoot an arrow there,
Nor come before it with shield,
Nor build a siege mound against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the way that he came,
By the same shall he return;
And he shall not come into this city,’
Says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘For I will defend this city, to save it
For My own sake and for My servant David’s sake.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of the Lord went out, and killed in the camp of the Assyrians one hundred and eighty-five thousand; and when people arose early in the morning, there were the corpses—all dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed and went away, returned home, and remained at Nineveh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass, as he was worshiping in the house of Nisroch his god, that his sons Adrammelech and Sharezer struck him down with the sword; and they escaped into the land of Ararat. Then Esarhaddon his son reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days Hezekiah was sick and near death. And Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, went to him and said to him, “Thus says the Lord: ‘Set your house in order, for you shall die and not live.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hezekiah turned his face toward the wall, and prayed to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Remember now, O Lord, I pray, how I have walked before You in truth and with a loyal heart, and have done what is good in Your sight.” And Hezekiah wept bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to Isaiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go and tell Hezekiah, ‘Thus says the Lord, the God of David your father: “I have heard your prayer, I have seen your tears; surely I will add to your days fifteen years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will deliver you and this city from the hand of the king of Assyria, and I will defend this city.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is the sign to you from the Lord, that the Lord will do this thing which He has spoken:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will bring the shadow on the sundial, which has gone down with the sun on the sundial of Ahaz, ten degrees backward.” So the sun returned ten degrees on the dial by which it had gone down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the writing of Hezekiah king of Judah, when he had been sick and had recovered from his sickness:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said,
“In the prime of my life
I shall go to the gates of Sheol;
I am deprived of the remainder of my years.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said,
“I shall not see Yah,
The Lord in the land of the living;
I shall observe man no more among the inhabitants of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I have considered until morning—
Like a lion,
So He breaks all my bones;
From day until night You make an end of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“What shall I say?
He has both spoken to me,
And He Himself has done it.
I shall walk carefully all my years
In the bitterness of my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed it was for my own peace
That I had great bitterness;
But You have lovingly delivered my soul from the pit of corruption,
For You have cast all my sins behind Your back.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Now Isaiah had said, “Let them take a lump of figs, and apply it as a poultice on the boil, and he shall recover.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Hezekiah had said, “What is the sign that I shall go up to the house of the Lord?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Merodach-Baladan the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a present to Hezekiah, for he heard that he had been sick and had recovered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Hezekiah was pleased with them, and showed them the house of his treasures—the silver and gold, the spices and precious ointment, and all his armory—all that was found among his treasures. There was nothing in his house or in all his dominion that Hezekiah did not show them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Isaiah the prophet went to King Hezekiah, and said to him, “What did these men say, and from where did they come to you?”
So Hezekiah said, “They came to me from a far country, from Babylon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he said, “What have they seen in your house?”
So Hezekiah answered, “They have seen all that is in my house; there is nothing among my treasures that I have not shown them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Hear the word of the Lord of hosts:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Behold, the days are coming when all that is in your house, and what your fathers have accumulated until this day, shall be carried to Babylon; nothing shall be left,’ says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘And they shall take away some of your sons who will descend from you, whom you will beget; and they shall be eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Hezekiah said to Isaiah, “The word of the Lord which you have spoken is good!” For he said, “At least there will be peace and truth in my days.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Comfort, yes, comfort My people!”
Says your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Speak comfort to Jerusalem, and cry out to her,
That her warfare is ended,
That her iniquity is pardoned;
For she has received from the Lord’s hand
Double for all her sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The voice of one crying in the wilderness:
“Prepare the way of the Lord;
Make straight in the desert
A highway for our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The voice said, “Cry out!”
And he said, “What shall I cry?” 
“All flesh is grass,
And all its loveliness is like the flower of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The grass withers, the flower fades,
But the word of our God stands forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Zion,
You who bring good tidings,
Get up into the high mountain;
O Jerusalem,
You who bring good tidings,
Lift up your voice with strength,
Lift it up, be not afraid;
Say to the cities of Judah, “Behold your God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, the Lord God shall come with a strong hand,
And His arm shall rule for Him;
Behold, His reward is with Him,
And His work before Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will feed His flock like a shepherd;
He will gather the lambs with His arm,
And carry them in His bosom,
And gently lead those who are with young.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who has measured the waters in the hollow of His hand,
Measured heaven with a span
And calculated the dust of the earth in a measure?
Weighed the mountains in scales
And the hills in a balance?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who has directed the Spirit of the Lord,
Or as His counselor has taught Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With whom did He take counsel, and who instructed Him,
And taught Him in the path of justice?
Who taught Him knowledge,
And showed Him the way of understanding?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And Lebanon is not sufficient to burn,
Nor its beasts sufficient for a burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All nations before Him are as nothing,
And they are counted by Him less than nothing and worthless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To whom then will you liken God?
Or what likeness will you compare to Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The workman molds an image,
The goldsmith overspreads it with gold,
And the silversmith casts silver chains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever is too impoverished for such a contribution
Chooses a tree that will not rot;
He seeks for himself a skillful workman
To prepare a carved image that will not totter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you not known?
Have you not heard?
Has it not been told you from the beginning?
Have you not understood from the foundations of the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is He who sits above the circle of the earth,
And its inhabitants are like grasshoppers,
Who stretches out the heavens like a curtain,
And spreads them out like a tent to dwell in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He brings the princes to nothing;
He makes the judges of the earth useless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Scarcely shall they be planted,
Scarcely shall they be sown,
Scarcely shall their stock take root in the earth,
When He will also blow on them,
And they will wither,
And the whirlwind will take them away like stubble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“To whom then will you liken Me,
Or to whom shall I be equal?” says the Holy One.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lift up your eyes on high,
And see who has created these things,
Who brings out their host by number;
He calls them all by name,
By the greatness of His might
And the strength of His power;
Not one is missing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you say, O Jacob,
And speak, O Israel:
“My way is hidden from the Lord,
And my just claim is passed over by my God”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you not known?
Have you not heard?
The everlasting God, the Lord,
The Creator of the ends of the earth,
Neither faints nor is weary.
His understanding is unsearchable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gives power to the weak,
And to those who have no might He increases strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the youths shall faint and be weary,
And the young men shall utterly fall,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But those who wait on the Lord
Shall renew their strength;
They shall mount up with wings like eagles,
They shall run and not be weary,
They shall walk and not faint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Keep silence before Me, O coastlands,
And let the people renew their strength!
Let them come near, then let them speak;
Let us come near together for judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Who raised up one from the east?
Who in righteousness called him to His feet?
Who gave the nations before him,
And made him rule over kings?
Who gave them as the dust to his sword,
As driven stubble to his bow?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who pursued them, and passed safely
By the way that he had not gone with his feet?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who has performed and done it,
Calling the generations from the beginning?
‘I, the Lord, am the first;
And with the last I am He.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Everyone helped his neighbor,
And said to his brother,
“Be of good courage!”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“But you, Israel, are My servant,
Jacob whom I have chosen,
The descendants of Abraham My friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You whom I have taken from the ends of the earth,
And called from its farthest regions,
And said to you,
‘You are My servant,
I have chosen you and have not cast you away:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fear not, for I am with you;
Be not dismayed, for I am your God.
I will strengthen you,
Yes, I will help you,
I will uphold you with My righteous right hand.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, all those who were incensed against you
Shall be ashamed and disgraced;
They shall be as nothing,
And those who strive with you shall perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You shall seek them and not find them—
Those who contended with you.
Those who war against you
Shall be as nothing,
As a nonexistent thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I, the Lord your God, will hold your right hand,
Saying to you, ‘Fear not, I will help you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Fear not, you worm Jacob,
You men of Israel!
I will help you,” says the Lord
And your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You shall winnow them, the wind shall carry them away,
And the whirlwind shall scatter them;
You shall rejoice in the Lord,
And glory in the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The poor and needy seek water, but there is none,
Their tongues fail for thirst.
I, the Lord, will hear them;
I, the God of Israel, will not forsake them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will open rivers in desolate heights,
And fountains in the midst of the valleys;
I will make the wilderness a pool of water,
And the dry land springs of water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will plant in the wilderness the cedar and the acacia tree,
The myrtle and the oil tree;
I will set in the desert the cypress tree and the pine
And the box tree together,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That they may see and know,
And consider and understand together,
That the hand of the Lord has done this,
And the Holy One of Israel has created it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Present your case,” says the Lord.
“Bring forth your strong reasons,” says the King of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Show the things that are to come hereafter,
That we may know that you are gods;
Yes, do good or do evil,
That we may be dismayed and see it together.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who has declared from the beginning, that we may know?
And former times, that we may say, ‘He is righteous’?
Surely there is no one who shows,
Surely there is no one who declares,
Surely there is no one who hears your words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The first time I said to Zion,
‘Look, there they are!’
And I will give to Jerusalem one who brings good tidings.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold! My Servant whom I uphold,
My Elect One in whom My soul delights!
I have put My Spirit upon Him;
He will bring forth justice to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not cry out, nor raise His voice,
Nor cause His voice to be heard in the street.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says God the Lord,
Who created the heavens and stretched them out,
Who spread forth the earth and that which comes from it,
Who gives breath to the people on it,
And spirit to those who walk on it:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I, the Lord, have called You in righteousness,
And will hold Your hand;
I will keep You and give You as a covenant to the people,
As a light to the Gentiles,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To open blind eyes,
To bring out prisoners from the prison,
Those who sit in darkness from the prison house.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord a new song,
And His praise from the ends of the earth,
You who go down to the sea, and all that is in it,
You coastlands and you inhabitants of them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the wilderness and its cities lift up their voice,
The villages that Kedar inhabits.
Let the inhabitants of Sela sing,
Let them shout from the top of the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them give glory to the Lord,
And declare His praise in the coastlands.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“I have held My peace a long time,
I have been still and restrained Myself.
Now I will cry like a woman in labor,
I will pant and gasp at once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will lay waste the mountains and hills,
And dry up all their vegetation;
I will make the rivers coastlands,
And I will dry up the pools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will bring the blind by a way they did not know;
I will lead them in paths they have not known.
I will make darkness light before them,
And crooked places straight.
These things I will do for them,
And not forsake them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall be turned back,
They shall be greatly ashamed,
Who trust in carved images,
Who say to the molded images,
‘You are our gods.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Hear, you deaf;
And look, you blind, that you may see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is blind but My servant,
Or deaf as My messenger whom I send?
Who is blind as he who is perfect,
And blind as the Lord’s servant?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seeing many things, but you do not observe;
Opening the ears, but he does not hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is well pleased for His righteousness’ sake;
He will exalt the law and make it honorable.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who among you will give ear to this?
Who will listen and hear for the time to come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who gave Jacob for plunder, and Israel to the robbers?
Was it not the Lord,
He against whom we have sinned?
For they would not walk in His ways,
Nor were they obedient to His law.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
When you pass through the waters, I will be with you;
And through the rivers, they shall not overflow you.
When you walk through the fire, you shall not be burned,
Nor shall the flame scorch you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I am the Lord your God,
The Holy One of Israel, your Savior;
I gave Egypt for your ransom,
Ethiopia and Seba in your place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Since you were precious in My sight,
You have been honored,
And I have loved you;
Therefore I will give men for you,
And people for your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will say to the north, ‘Give them up!’
And to the south, ‘Do not keep them back!’
Bring My sons from afar,
And My daughters from the ends of the earth—
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Bring out the blind people who have eyes,
And the deaf who have ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let all the nations be gathered together,
And let the people be assembled.
Who among them can declare this,
And show us former things?
Let them bring out their witnesses, that they may be justified;
Or let them hear and say, “It is truth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You are My witnesses,” says the Lord,
“And My servant whom I have chosen,
That you may know and believe Me,
And understand that I am He.
Before Me there was no God formed,
Nor shall there be after Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I, even I, am the Lord,
And besides Me there is no savior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have declared and saved,
I have proclaimed,
And there was no foreign god among you;
Therefore you are My witnesses,”
Says the Lord, “that I am God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord, your Redeemer,
The Holy One of Israel:
“For your sake I will send to Babylon,
And bring them all down as fugitives—
The Chaldeans, who rejoice in their ships.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am the Lord, your Holy One,
The Creator of Israel, your King.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord, who makes a way in the sea
And a path through the mighty waters,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who brings forth the chariot and horse,
The army and the power
(They shall lie down together, they shall not rise;
They are extinguished, they are quenched like a wick):
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Do not remember the former things,
Nor consider the things of old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I will do a new thing,
Now it shall spring forth;
Shall you not know it?
I will even make a road in the wilderness
And rivers in the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The beast of the field will honor Me,
The jackals and the ostriches,
Because I give waters in the wilderness
And rivers in the desert,
To give drink to My people, My chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This people I have formed for Myself;
They shall declare My praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But you have not called upon Me, O Jacob;
And you have been weary of Me, O Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have not brought Me the sheep for your burnt offerings,
Nor have you honored Me with your sacrifices.
I have not caused you to serve with grain offerings,
Nor wearied you with incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have bought Me no sweet cane with money,
Nor have you satisfied Me with the fat of your sacrifices;
But you have burdened Me with your sins,
You have wearied Me with your iniquities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I, even I, am He who blots out your transgressions for My own sake;
And I will not remember your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your first father sinned,
And your mediators have transgressed against Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Yet hear now, O Jacob My servant,
And Israel whom I have chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord who made you
And formed you from the womb, who will help you:
‘Fear not, O Jacob My servant;
And you, Jeshurun, whom I have chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They will spring up among the grass
Like willows by the watercourses.’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Thus says the Lord, the King of Israel,
And his Redeemer, the Lord of hosts:
‘I am the First and I am the Last;
Besides Me there is no God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And who can proclaim as I do?
Then let him declare it and set it in order for Me,
Since I appointed the ancient people.
And the things that are coming and shall come,
Let them show these to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who would form a god or mold an image
That profits him nothing?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The blacksmith with the tongs works one in the coals,
Fashions it with hammers,
And works it with the strength of his arms.
Even so, he is hungry, and his strength fails;
He drinks no water and is faint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The craftsman stretches out his rule,
He marks one out with chalk;
He fashions it with a plane,
He marks it out with the compass,
And makes it like the figure of a man,
According to the beauty of a man, that it may remain in the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He cuts down cedars for himself,
And takes the cypress and the oak;
He secures it for himself among the trees of the forest.
He plants a pine, and the rain nourishes it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And the rest of it he makes into a god,
His carved image.
He falls down before it and worships it,
Prays to it and says,
“Deliver me, for you are my god!”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And no one considers in his heart,
Nor is there knowledge nor understanding to say,
“I have burned half of it in the fire,
Yes, I have also baked bread on its coals;
I have roasted meat and eaten it;
And shall I make the rest of it an abomination?
Shall I fall down before a block of wood?”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I have blotted out, like a thick cloud, your transgressions,
And like a cloud, your sins.
Return to Me, for I have redeemed you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing, O heavens, for the Lord has done it!
Shout, you lower parts of the earth;
Break forth into singing, you mountains,
O forest, and every tree in it!
For the Lord has redeemed Jacob,
And glorified Himself in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord, your Redeemer,
And He who formed you from the womb:
“I am the Lord, who makes all things,
Who stretches out the heavens all alone,
Who spreads abroad the earth by Myself;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who says to the deep, ‘Be dry!
And I will dry up your rivers’;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who says of Cyrus, ‘He is My shepherd,
And he shall perform all My pleasure,
Saying to Jerusalem, “You shall be built,”
And to the temple, “Your foundation shall be laid.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Thus says the Lord to His anointed,
To Cyrus, whose right hand I have held—
To subdue nations before him
And loose the armor of kings,
To open before him the double doors,
So that the gates will not be shut:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘I will go before you
And make the crooked places straight;
I will break in pieces the gates of bronze
And cut the bars of iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give you the treasures of darkness
And hidden riches of secret places,
That you may know that I, the Lord,
Who call you by your name,
Am the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Jacob My servant’s sake,
And Israel My elect,
I have even called you by your name;
I have named you, though you have not known Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Rain down, you heavens, from above,
And let the skies pour down righteousness;
Let the earth open, let them bring forth salvation,
And let righteousness spring up together.
I, the Lord, have created it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to him who strives with his Maker!
Let the potsherd strive with the potsherds of the earth!
Shall the clay say to him who forms it, ‘What are you making?’
Or shall your handiwork say, ‘He has no hands’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to him who says to his father, ‘What are you begetting?’
Or to the woman, ‘What have you brought forth?’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord,
The Holy One of Israel, and his Maker:
“Ask Me of things to come concerning My sons;
And concerning the work of My hands, you command Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have made the earth,
And created man on it.
I—My hands—stretched out the heavens,
And all their host I have commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have raised him up in righteousness,
And I will direct all his ways;
He shall build My city
And let My exiles go free,
Not for price nor reward,”
Says the Lord of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Truly You are God, who hide Yourself,
O God of Israel, the Savior!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall be ashamed
And also disgraced, all of them;
They shall go in confusion together,
Who are makers of idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Israel shall be saved by the Lord
With an everlasting salvation;
You shall not be ashamed or disgraced
Forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thus says the Lord,
Who created the heavens,
Who is God,
Who formed the earth and made it,
Who has established it,
Who did not create it in vain,
Who formed it to be inhabited:
“I am the Lord, and there is no other.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Assemble yourselves and come;
Draw near together,
You who have escaped from the nations.
They have no knowledge,
Who carry the wood of their carved image,
And pray to a god that cannot save.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tell and bring forth your case;
Yes, let them take counsel together.
Who has declared this from ancient time?
Who has told it from that time?
Have not I, the Lord?
And there is no other God besides Me,
A just God and a Savior;
There is none besides Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Look to Me, and be saved,
All you ends of the earth!
For I am God, and there is no other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have sworn by Myself;
The word has gone out of My mouth in righteousness,
And shall not return,
That to Me every knee shall bow,
Every tongue shall take an oath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall say,
‘Surely in the Lord I have righteousness and strength.
To Him men shall come,
And all shall be ashamed
Who are incensed against Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the Lord all the descendants of Israel
Shall be justified, and shall glory.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bel bows down, Nebo stoops;
Their idols were on the beasts and on the cattle.
Your carriages were heavily loaded,
A burden to the weary beast.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Listen to Me, O house of Jacob,
And all the remnant of the house of Israel,
Who have been upheld by Me from birth,
Who have been carried from the womb:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even to your old age, I am He,
And even to gray hairs I will carry you!
I have made, and I will bear;
Even I will carry, and will deliver you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“To whom will you liken Me, and make Me equal
And compare Me, that we should be alike?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They bear it on the shoulder, they carry it
And set it in its place, and it stands;
From its place it shall not move.
Though one cries out to it, yet it cannot answer
Nor save him out of his trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Remember this, and show yourselves men;
Recall to mind, O you transgressors.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Declaring the end from the beginning,
And from ancient times things that are not yet done,
Saying, ‘My counsel shall stand,
And I will do all My pleasure,’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Listen to Me, you stubborn-hearted,
Who are far from righteousness:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I bring My righteousness near, it shall not be far off;
My salvation shall not linger.
And I will place salvation in Zion,
For Israel My glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Come down and sit in the dust,
O virgin daughter of Babylon;
Sit on the ground without a throne,
O daughter of the Chaldeans!
For you shall no more be called
Tender and delicate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take the millstones and grind meal.
Remove your veil,
Take off the skirt,
Uncover the thigh,
Pass through the rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your nakedness shall be uncovered,
Yes, your shame will be seen;
I will take vengeance,
And I will not arbitrate with a man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for our Redeemer, the Lord of hosts is His name,
The Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Sit in silence, and go into darkness,
O daughter of the Chaldeans;
For you shall no longer be called
The Lady of Kingdoms.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And you said, ‘I shall be a lady forever,’
So that you did not take these things to heart,
Nor remember the latter end of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But these two things shall come to you
In a moment, in one day:
The loss of children, and widowhood.
They shall come upon you in their fullness
Because of the multitude of your sorceries,
For the great abundance of your enchantments.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Stand now with your enchantments
And the multitude of your sorceries,
In which you have labored from your youth—
Perhaps you will be able to profit,
Perhaps you will prevail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are wearied in the multitude of your counsels;
Let now the astrologers, the stargazers,
And the monthly prognosticators
Stand up and save you
From what shall come upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Thus shall they be to you
With whom you have labored,
Your merchants from your youth;
They shall wander each one to his quarter.
No one shall save you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Because I knew that you were obstinate,
And your neck was an iron sinew,
And your brow bronze,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even from the beginning I have declared it to you;
Before it came to pass I proclaimed it to you,
Lest you should say, ‘My idol has done them,
And my carved image and my molded image
Have commanded them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You have heard;
See all this.
And will you not declare it?
I have made you hear new things from this time,
Even hidden things, and you did not know them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Surely you did not hear,
Surely you did not know;
Surely from long ago your ear was not opened.
For I knew that you would deal very treacherously,
And were called a transgressor from the womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For My name’s sake I will defer My anger,
And for My praise I will restrain it from you,
So that I do not cut you off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I have refined you, but not as silver;
I have tested you in the furnace of affliction.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Listen to Me, O Jacob,
And Israel, My called:
I am He, I am the First,
I am also the Last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed My hand has laid the foundation of the earth,
And My right hand has stretched out the heavens;
When I call to them,
They stand up together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“All of you, assemble yourselves, and hear!
Who among them has declared these things?
The Lord loves him;
He shall do His pleasure on Babylon,
And His arm shall be against the Chaldeans.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Come near to Me, hear this:
I have not spoken in secret from the beginning;
From the time that it was, I was there.
And now the Lord God and His Spirit
Have sent Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord, your Redeemer,
The Holy One of Israel:
“I am the Lord your God,
Who teaches you to profit,
Who leads you by the way you should go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, that you had heeded My commandments!
Then your peace would have been like a river,
And your righteousness like the waves of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your descendants also would have been like the sand,
And the offspring of your body like the grains of sand;
His name would not have been cut off
Nor destroyed from before Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go forth from Babylon!
Flee from the Chaldeans!
With a voice of singing,
Declare, proclaim this,
Utter it to the end of the earth;
Say, “The Lord has redeemed
His servant Jacob!”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: “There is no peace,” says the Lord, “for the wicked.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Listen, O coastlands, to Me,
And take heed, you peoples from afar!
The Lord has called Me from the womb;
From the matrix of My mother He has made mention of My name.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“And He said to me,
‘You are My servant, O Israel,
In whom I will be glorified.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I said, ‘I have labored in vain,
I have spent my strength for nothing and in vain;
Yet surely my just reward is with the Lord,
And my work with my God.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And now the Lord says,
Who formed Me from the womb to be His Servant,
To bring Jacob back to Him,
So that Israel is gathered to Him
(For I shall be glorious in the eyes of the Lord,
And My God shall be My strength),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed He says,
‘It is too small a thing that You should be My Servant
To raise up the tribes of Jacob,
And to restore the preserved ones of Israel;
I will also give You as a light to the Gentiles,
That You should be My salvation to the ends of the earth.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord,
The Redeemer of Israel, their Holy One,
To Him whom man despises,
To Him whom the nation abhors,
To the Servant of rulers:
“Kings shall see and arise,
Princes also shall worship,
Because of the Lord who is faithful,
The Holy One of Israel;
And He has chosen You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“In an acceptable time I have heard You,
And in the day of salvation I have helped You;
I will preserve You and give You
As a covenant to the people,
To restore the earth,
To cause them to inherit the desolate heritages;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That You may say to the prisoners, ‘Go forth,’
To those who are in darkness, ‘Show yourselves.’ 
“They shall feed along the roads,
And their pastures shall be on all desolate heights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall neither hunger nor thirst,
Neither heat nor sun shall strike them;
For He who has mercy on them will lead them,
Even by the springs of water He will guide them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make each of My mountains a road,
And My highways shall be elevated.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Sing, O heavens!
Be joyful, O earth!
And break out in singing, O mountains!
For the Lord has comforted His people,
And will have mercy on His afflicted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Zion said, “The Lord has forsaken me,
And my Lord has forgotten me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Can a woman forget her nursing child,
And not have compassion on the son of her womb?
Surely they may forget,
Yet I will not forget you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See, I have inscribed you on the palms of My hands;
Your walls are continually before Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Lift up your eyes, look around and see;
All these gather together and come to you.
As I live,” says the Lord,
“You shall surely clothe yourselves with them all as an ornament,
And bind them on you as a bride does.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For your waste and desolate places,
And the land of your destruction,
Will even now be too small for the inhabitants;
And those who swallowed you up will be far away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The children you will have,
After you have lost the others,
Will say again in your ears,
‘The place is too small for me;
Give me a place where I may dwell.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will say in your heart,
‘Who has begotten these for me,
Since I have lost my children and am desolate,
A captive, and wandering to and fro?
And who has brought these up?
There I was, left alone;
But these, where were they?’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Kings shall be your foster fathers,
And their queens your nursing mothers;
They shall bow down to you with their faces to the earth,
And lick up the dust of your feet.
Then you will know that I am the Lord,
For they shall not be ashamed who wait for Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall the prey be taken from the mighty,
Or the captives of the righteous be delivered?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But thus says the Lord:
“Even the captives of the mighty shall be taken away,
And the prey of the terrible be delivered;
For I will contend with him who contends with you,
And I will save your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will feed those who oppress you with their own flesh,
And they shall be drunk with their own blood as with sweet wine.
All flesh shall know
That I, the Lord, am your Savior,
And your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“Where is the certificate of your mother’s divorce,
Whom I have put away?
Or which of My creditors is it to whom I have sold you?
For your iniquities you have sold yourselves,
And for your transgressions your mother has been put away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why, when I came, was there no man?
Why, when I called, was there none to answer?
Is My hand shortened at all that it cannot redeem?
Or have I no power to deliver?
Indeed with My rebuke I dry up the sea,
I make the rivers a wilderness;
Their fish stink because there is no water,
And die of thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I clothe the heavens with blackness,
And I make sackcloth their covering.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Lord God has given Me
The tongue of the learned,
That I should know how to speak
A word in season to him who is weary.
He awakens Me morning by morning,
He awakens My ear
To hear as the learned.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He is near who justifies Me;
Who will contend with Me?
Let us stand together.
Who is My adversary?
Let him come near Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Who among you fears the Lord?
Who obeys the voice of His Servant?
Who walks in darkness
And has no light?
Let him trust in the name of the Lord
And rely upon his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, all you who kindle a fire,
Who encircle yourselves with sparks:
Walk in the light of your fire and in the sparks you have kindled—
This you shall have from My hand:
You shall lie down in torment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Listen to Me, you who follow after righteousness,
You who seek the Lord:
Look to the rock from which you were hewn,
And to the hole of the pit from which you were dug.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look to Abraham your father,
And to Sarah who bore you;
For I called him alone,
And blessed him and increased him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Listen to Me, My people;
And give ear to Me, O My nation:
For law will proceed from Me,
And I will make My justice rest
As a light of the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My righteousness is near,
My salvation has gone forth,
And My arms will judge the peoples;
The coastlands will wait upon Me,
And on My arm they will trust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lift up your eyes to the heavens,
And look on the earth beneath.
For the heavens will vanish away like smoke,
The earth will grow old like a garment,
And those who dwell in it will die in like manner;
But My salvation will be forever,
And My righteousness will not be abolished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Listen to Me, you who know righteousness,
You people in whose heart is My law:
Do not fear the reproach of men,
Nor be afraid of their insults.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the moth will eat them up like a garment,
And the worm will eat them like wool;
But My righteousness will be forever,
And My salvation from generation to generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Awake, awake, put on strength,
O arm of the Lord!
Awake as in the ancient days,
In the generations of old.
Are You not the arm that cut Rahab apart,
And wounded the serpent?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Are You not the One who dried up the sea,
The waters of the great deep;
That made the depths of the sea a road
For the redeemed to cross over?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the ransomed of the Lord shall return,
And come to Zion with singing,
With everlasting joy on their heads.
They shall obtain joy and gladness;
Sorrow and sighing shall flee away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I, even I, am He who comforts you.
Who are you that you should be afraid
Of a man who will die,
And of the son of a man who will be made like grass?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And you forget the Lord your Maker,
Who stretched out the heavens
And laid the foundations of the earth;
You have feared continually every day
Because of the fury of the oppressor,
When he has prepared to destroy.
And where is the fury of the oppressor?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The captive exile hastens, that he may be loosed,
That he should not die in the pit,
And that his bread should not fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I am the Lord your God,
Who divided the sea whose waves roared—
The Lord of hosts is His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I have put My words in your mouth;
I have covered you with the shadow of My hand,
That I may plant the heavens,
Lay the foundations of the earth,
And say to Zion, ‘You are My people.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Awake, awake!
Stand up, O Jerusalem,
You who have drunk at the hand of the Lord
The cup of His fury;
You have drunk the dregs of the cup of trembling,
And drained it out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is no one to guide her
Among all the sons she has brought forth;
Nor is there any who takes her by the hand
Among all the sons she has brought up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These two things have come to you;
Who will be sorry for you?—
Desolation and destruction, famine and sword—
By whom will I comfort you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your sons have fainted,
They lie at the head of all the streets,
Like an antelope in a net;
They are full of the fury of the Lord,
The rebuke of your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore please hear this, you afflicted,
And drunk but not with wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says your Lord,
The Lord and your God,
Who pleads the cause of His people:
“See, I have taken out of your hand
The cup of trembling,
The dregs of the cup of My fury;
You shall no longer drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I will put it into the hand of those who afflict you,
Who have said to you,
‘Lie down, that we may walk over you.’
And you have laid your body like the ground,
And as the street, for those who walk over.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Awake, awake!
Put on your strength, O Zion;
Put on your beautiful garments,
O Jerusalem, the holy city!
For the uncircumcised and the unclean
Shall no longer come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shake yourself from the dust, arise;
Sit down, O Jerusalem!
Loose yourself from the bonds of your neck,
O captive daughter of Zion!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thus says the Lord:
“You have sold yourselves for nothing,
And you shall be redeemed without money.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thus says the Lord God:
“My people went down at first
Into Egypt to dwell there;
Then the Assyrian oppressed them without cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now therefore, what have I here,” says the Lord,
“That My people are taken away for nothing?
Those who rule over them
Make them wail,” says the Lord,
“And My name is blasphemed continually every day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore My people shall know My name;
Therefore they shall know in that day
That I am He who speaks:
‘Behold, it is I.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How beautiful upon the mountains
Are the feet of him who brings good news,
Who proclaims peace,
Who brings glad tidings of good things,
Who proclaims salvation,
Who says to Zion,
“Your God reigns!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your watchmen shall lift up their voices,
With their voices they shall sing together;
For they shall see eye to eye
When the Lord brings back Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Break forth into joy, sing together,
You waste places of Jerusalem!
For the Lord has comforted His people,
He has redeemed Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has made bare His holy arm
In the eyes of all the nations;
And all the ends of the earth shall see
The salvation of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Depart! Depart! Go out from there,
Touch no unclean thing;
Go out from the midst of her,
Be clean,
You who bear the vessels of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you shall not go out with haste,
Nor go by flight;
For the Lord will go before you,
And the God of Israel will be your rear guard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, My Servant shall deal prudently;
He shall be exalted and extolled and be very high.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
So shall He sprinkle many nations.
Kings shall shut their mouths at Him;
